title: When you are the jungler, and every lane begins falling at once

replies.body: usually mean you didn't have any lane pressure of any kind anywhere
Nah, it was Noob teammates/The enemy was OP/I was lagging/Riot can't balance the game. It wasn't my fault.

For me it's It was noob me/The enemy was better/I was lagging

Usually it's the lag. I hate lag.

You can carry the game if your good enough so dont say your team held you back because the game is only limited by your skill. And Riot has balanced the game several times and I feel some of the best parts of Season 4 and 5 were very balanced. The only problem is the game would not be as fun if everything was balanced. You have to admit you like it when your  main gets buffed or your biggest counter gets a nerf. Patch notes that make the game unbalanced  are apart of the game. It makes the game different every time making for changes in play style and keeps you working to get good at what is currently that patch.

Not always.

31/12/13 Eve Jungle, 4.8 CS/Min, 26K (I was popping elixirs like candy near the end just to push that last little bit of performance out of Evelynn; swapping between Iron and Sorcery depending on what I needed to do next). S+ rank. Still lost.

The start of our problems was that our top (who was really chill and truly trying his best, so I couldn't get mad at him) fed the hell out of Teemo early; this caused issues with mushrooms in the mid game as well as Teemo nuking the rest of my team; he would run anytime I showed up (managed to get him once or twice in the early game). Shen didn't really recover until we were too deep in the hole tower wise to get out of it. Like I said, he tried his damnedest and I appreciated it.

The other big mitigating factor was because Teemo was so far ahead early, three of us ran sweepers and thus our vision suffered. At one point I swapped jungle items just to ward Baron and then backing to get my blue smite back.

It got to the point where even though we were ahead in kills overall, it didn't matter as Teemo shrooms kept us from taking towers efficiently. Also, my team was so afraid of Teemo that they wouldn't risk towers without minion waves. I did a few times (sweeper OP), but Eve isn't exactly great at tower killing and had to run before doing anything significant.

In spite of all this, it was one of the most intense and fun matches I have played this season. Shen was awesome attitude wise. No one got mad when the one surrender vote that was posed failed; we accepted that we would play it to the end and everyone put in a solid effort to win.

TL;DR: It doesn't matter how hard you carry as a jungler, if the enemy Teemo is fed you are in for a world of pain.

{{item:3751}} {{champion:17}} {{item:3751}} 

...makes...

{{item:3070}} {{champion:28}} {{item:3070}}

Well in my book you did not carry enough. In some way you were outplayed. There is always a way too carry a game and by you showing me a game where you did really good but still did not carry and win does not prove what I said was wrong.
In a team game such as this, it's entirely possible (honestly, I'd say it's quite common) to have a situation where you CAN'T pick up the slack all by yourself.

> [{quoted}](name=Totalwanabe,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YWjW40dW,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-03-23T14:02:45.595+0000)
>
> usually mean you didn't have any lane pressure of any kind anywhere

Iv had games where i get several kills for my laner, but the enemy laner wins because he is just better at the game. not much you can do about it besides move on (whether you won or lost) and hope you dont get him on your team again

Lost a game about 2 days ago where i was 8/0 as {{champion:254}} . ganked and got a kill twice mid, 3 times top, killed the enemy jungler in jg and river twice, and picked one up down bot.

Went legendary and the overall score was 12-11. my team being the 11. at one point my adc {{champion:110}}  was 0/9/5 whining he was getting KS'ed and camped and calling me a terrible jungler when i was jumping his shit for dying left and right without bothering to try and play safe or group.

His support bought SS and dropped tons of wards but he never went near his supp so he whined all game we never had vision. he roamed on his own and the complained when he died, complained when i told him to stay by me for protection because apparently i "couldn't protect him", and got flamed all to hell when i spent all game pointing out his mistakes and BEGGING his ass to just work with me and the team.

we lost. twas a good run. I now keep alcohol on hand when i play ranked in order to keep from venting to hard in chat and getting banned.

Edit: on a side note though when you get so fed as Vi that you're chasing down a {{champion:17}}  for a gank and the enemy Leblanc stops your dive with a body block and you accidentaly kill her with a Q-E-R combo. good times. I wasn't even aiming for her but she Ate the Q and i just pressed R. no more magic bitch.

To be fair, sometimes every lane on your team dies before you finish a complete clear.
It just happens sometimes.

Now when all of your lanes lose all the time every game, THEN you have something to look at introspectively.
Sometimes your team really is a Your Team

SHUT THE FUCK UP YOU PIECE OF FUCKING SHITHSITHASKJDGHAKJDGA
kappa
But for real tho..
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}
I mean, you could say that, or you could also say that not one of your team could win a fair fight.
You do realize the irony of the fact that that exploding ship was entirely Becket's fault?
Are you blaming the jungles for trash landers?
Yes. Come at me brosef, 1v1 in dominion

Was that a typo or a pun?

Heh. Trash landers. Sounds like a TV show.
Junglers can have a surprising impact on any one lane ... question being wether that will be enough.
That sad moment when you hear first blood when you are taking blue/red and know you will get the blame.
It makes me sad when this happens. So much for jungling today.

More like my life when I pressed install

**THERE IS NO GOING BACKKK**
The same applies to when you're winning your solo lane but see the other 2 lanes falling apart and your jungler is unable to save them

> [{quoted}](name=WutsKraken,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=YWjW40dW,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-03-23T19:34:26.528+0000)
>
> The same applies to when you're winning your solo lane but see the other 2 lanes falling apart and your jungler is unable to save them

If you are winning your solo lane hard, then you should be roaming to assist your jungler honestly. you can do 4 man dives, 3 man dives, take turrets and dragon. Why? because you have the numbers advantage, abuse it by taking everything. The enemy laner will be playing catch up and will most likely be tilted if you killed him repeatedly so he will most likely stay in his lane to farm. Im not saying you dont do this, im only saying that responsibility to carry the game falls on your shoulders when you win lane hard.

You weren't present in my last game

I was ahead, not snowballing, but slightly ahead and doing what you said

But who was roaming and getting fed? Who was snowballing? Who could completely shut me down every time I tried to teleport and roam?

Enemy midlaner

When you are ww farming as fast as possible for your 6 and when you finaly hit 6 your team is 0/10 and already lost 2 towers.

Then after 40 min of harassing plays, you win.










Just kidding, game's over in 20 minuts.

So gank before 6.

If you actually require the ult to pull off a gank you should probably practice more with bots before inflicting your mediocrity with that character on other players.  You should be popping out of the jungle to help long before things can get to 0/10.
I main warwick, and except for some very particular scenarios, you never ever ever ever want to gank before 6 or without ult.

I played a ww game last season. when I hit 6 we were already too far behind. Somehow, we were able to take one of their inhibs, before never leaving our side of the map again. they had a very fed Yi/Cait combo, and the only way to survive more than 5 seconds was me ulting the Yi at every opportunity. despite being down gold, kills, and towers, we won. The enemy team was so caught up in trying to finish us that the Winions finally destroyed the nexus. The game went on 60 min. and we had to weather 2-3 surrender votes.

literally my last game

FUCK
